newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks end flat as sales dry up.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks end flat as sales dry up.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed flat on Thursday due to a lack of sellers, but brokers said they were not sure whether the market had bottomed out.
The all share index closed just 1.09 points down at 733.11. Price declines led gains by 40 to 25. Development Finance fell one rupee to 278, Ceylon Oxygen 2.75 to 60.25.
"Selling has dried up, which could be an indication that profit-taking has ended," said Rohan Fernando of brokerage CT Smith. "But we are not sure if it will see a return of buying."
Colombo stocks have fallen 1.8 percent, or 13.3 points, this week on retail profit-taking, after the index rose over 25 points in the previous 10 days.
Turnover was a low 44.3 million rupees, led by foreign buying of 223,000 Ceylon Brewery.
"We believe that prices should ease a bit more before buyers return to the market," said a broker at Jardine Fleming.
